summary: Asphyxia happens when your body doesn't get enough oxygen because of a problem with breathing. This can affect all your body's organs. It can be caused by many things, like not being able to breathe properly for a long time. Asphyxia can be very serious, leading to a coma or even death. In 2015, many people died from unintentional suffocation, which is a type of asphyxia. The word comes from Ancient Greek, meaning "without a throb of the heart."
title: Asphyxia
